greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = least number k such that n*k^n+1 is prime, or 0 if no such number exists.
comment: If a(n) = 0, then n is in A097792. Note that the converse is not true: a(4) = 1, not 0.
example: 3*1^3+1 = 4 is not prime. 3*2^3+1 = 25 is not prime. 3*3^3+1 = 82 is not prime. 3*4^3+1 = 193 is prime. Thus, a(3) = 4.
results.author: _Derek Orr_, Mar 29 2014
